"Filtering and search filters" tab
This tab configures filtering to display only registry objects meeting specified conditions.
Additionally, this tab enables user access to registry data search and filtering by predefined parameters.
Search filters are specialized tools appearing as panels with configured filtering and search parameters for registry data display.
For search filter configuration examples, refer to
this article
.
Setting up
The list of parameters depends on the selected registry type.
Setting
Purpose
Registry filter type
Specifies the type of registry column filter. Possible values:
excel;
In case of working with
type of column filter "Excel"
in the registry it is possible to add a filter fragment. That is, the end user can multiselect values. The action is performed similarly to working with filter in XLSX document.
There is also data filtering available to the user in working with attributes using string filters, for more information see
"Working with the object registry"
.
by row;
The "By row" filter displays data based on the value specified in the filter row:
unfiltered.
With this setting, there is no filtering tool
.
Preset filtering
Filter type
Defining the filtering method. The radiobutton type switch selects one of the three types, as a result the corresponding field for filter selection is displayed in the settings:
Filtering algorithm;
SQL condition;
Condition tree.
Algorithm for data filtering
Entering (selecting) an algorithm for data filtering. For more details see
"Configuring the filtering conditions"
.

Condition tree
Configuring filtering using the boolean condition constructor, for more information, see the

SQL based filter
Selecting SQL-based filter.

Search and custom filters
Display search filter
Boolean attribute that controls the display of search filters in the registry.
When the parameter is enabled, advanced search filter settings become available (covered
below
).
By default, the switch is inactive.
Custom filters
Specifying filters available to users in the dropdown list
in the registry control panel when filters are positioned at the top.
Existing filters are selected from a dropdown list, while new filters can be created via the parameterâ€™s action menu.
When adding custom filters, a modal window opens for creating filters based on
condition trees
.
Additional filters can be created directly in the object type instance registry. For details, see
"Working with Object Registries"
.
Parameter is available when the "Custom filters" toggle is active in the registry settings on the
"Control Panel"
tab.
Registry
Specifying the custom filters registry to be displayed in the "Custom filters" panel when filters are positioned to the left/right of the registry.
Selection is made from
basic registries
of type "Custom filter constructor" [SYS_USER_FILTER_TREE].
For convenient storage of configured custom filters, the
"Folders registry"
type registry is used.
If no parameter value is specified, the default registry is used.
Parameter is available when the "Custom filters" toggle is active in the registry settings on the
"Control Panel"
tab.
Unified placement of search and custom filters
Boolean attribute that determines the joint placement of search and custom filters based on the value of the "Filter Location" parameter: left, right, or top.
This parameter is available if the following toggles are simultaneously active:
"Custom Filters" in the registry settings on the
"Control Panel"
tab;
"Display Search Filters".
Placement of custom filters
Placement of custom filters in the workspace relative to the registry: left, right, or top.
Custom filters are displayed as a registry selection - when an item is selected, the main registry displays only objects that meet the filter conditions.
Depending on the parameter value, custom filters can be positioned:
As a dropdown list
in the registry control panel;
In the "Custom Filters" panel to the left/right of the registry.
By default, custom filters are positioned at the top.
This parameter is available when the
"Custom Filters"
switch is
active
in the registry settings on the
"Control Panel"
tab and the
"Display Search Filters"
switch is
inactive
.
Placement of search filters
Placement of search filters in the workspace relative to the registry: left, right, or top.
The placement of custom filters is fixed at the top in this case.
Depending on the parameter value, search filters can be positioned:
In a modal window when clicking the
icon in the registry control panel;
In the "Search Filters" panel to the left/right of the registry.
Usage example
The "Search Filters" panel configured to the left of the registry may appear as follows:
By default, search filters are positioned to the left of the registry.
This field is available when the
"Display Search Filters"
toggle is
active
and the
"Unified placement of search and custom filters"
toggle is
inactive

Filter placement
Placement of the filter panel in the workspace relative to the registry: left, right, or top.
The placement configuration applies to both search filters and custom filters when used together.
By default, the filter panel is positioned to the left of the registry.
This parameter is available if the following switches are simultaneously active:
"Custom filters" in the registry settings on the
"Control Panel"
tab;
"Display search filters";
"Unified placement of search and custom filters".
Filter width
The percentage of screen width occupied (must be between 15 and 50).
Width configuration applies to both search filters and custom filters when used together.
By default, the filter panel occupies 30% of the workspace.
This parameter is available when search filters and/or custom filters are displayed and positioned to the left or right.
Display the advanced search when opening the registry
The Boolean attribute controlling the display of either advanced search or the filtering panel.
By default, the switch is inactive, while the search bar is collapsed
:
Filtering visual
Specifies the visual for configuring the registry filtering panel.
This parameter is available when the "Display advanced search when opening registry" parameter is active.
Advanced configuration of search filters
Search bar
The search bar is configured using the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Display general search
When the switch is active, the normal search is replaced by "General search" the display of which can be configured similarly to the
"General Search" widget
, but only within the current object type.
Using general search implies searching by object name for the tiled registry
and searching by attributes for other registry visuals.
In general search the results are displayed in a drop-down list, the objects in the registry are not filtered.
There is no link to the object in the results, clicking on the result is equivalent to opening a profile. For a tiled registry, clicking on a result can lead to executing an action (if action override is configured) or navigating down the hierarchy (if the tiled registry has a hierarchy).
Search mode
When the switch is active, the search is performed in the "Search mode": when moving through the search results using the arrows on the keyboard, the entered query text will be replaced with the text of the search result.
When the switch is inactive, navigating through the search results using the arrows on the keyboard does not affect the query text - it remains static. After clicking the
in the search bar, the text of the search result will be copied to the search field, and the search results will be updated.
Example of active and inactive "Search mode"
Possibility to group search results by selected attribute.
If clicking the button, a modal window will be opened, where two tables are presented:
the left one presents the list of attributes by which the grouping can be configured;
the right table is used to directly add grouping attributes using the arrows
.
The order of added attributes, which determines the sequence in which objects are grouped when search results are displayed, is managed by arrows
.
By default, grouping by the "Object type" attribute is used.
Single click across the entire search result area
With the switch active, clicking any area of a search result will be equivalent to clicking an object link and will open the object profile (including clicks on navigation elements when chain of parent objects are displayed).
Exception: Clicking the
icon in the search bar when search mode is disabled will copy the search result text to the search field and refresh the results.
This parameter is available when "Display the navigation chain of parent objects" switch is active.
Display the navigation chain of parent objects
When the toggle switch is active for tile registries of a hierarchical type, the navigation panel will be displayed in the search results.
This parameter is only available in the tile registry type
.
Filters
To configure the filters, the following parameters must be used:
Setting
Purpose
Reset the navigation chain when search is applied
When the switch is active for hierarchical tile registries, search will be performed across all hierarchy levels (all objects).
This parameter is only displayed in
tile registry type
.
Applying search after changes
The option defines how the filtering process will be performed - immediately when entering/selecting data or after pressing the "Find" button.
Adding filters to the search and filter panel is accomplished through two tables:
1. Available attributes - the table contains all attributes of the object type for which the registry is being configured.
To display the attributes of the parent type, the corresponding switch must be active.
2. Search bar settings - a table that defines the attribute composition and how attributes are displayed on the interface of the search and filtering panel.
The attributes can be moved between the tables using the arrows located between the tables.
The attributes to be filtered by are selected in the left table and moved to the right table. Attributes in the right table can only be placed in a group, when attributes are moved, the first group is automatically created.
The business administrator can:
edit a group - by double-clicking/selecting the group and clicking on the
icon, which will open a modal window, where it is possible to edit name;
style -
formatting style
, which can be selected from the drop-down list of previously created styles or a new one can be created by clicking on the actions menu and selecting the "Add" option in the context menu.
group status - defining the collapsed/unfolded/static status;
hint - entering a hint for the user;
create new filter groups by clicking the
icon and selecting the option of the same name;
Breaking attributes into logically related groups improves the perception of information.
add a filter by rating by clicking on the
icon and selecting the option of the same name;
adjust the sequence of attributes placement on the panel using
, thus determining their belonging to one or another group of filters;
delete any item in the right table using the
icon;
When a filter group is deleted, all attributes added to this group will be deleted.
change the attribute representation on the search and filter panel by double-clicking/selecting the attribute and clicking on the
, as a result of which the System will display a form for data input, where:
name - filter name, by default it is used by attribute name;
visualization - the way of displaying the attribute on the search filters panel, the choice is made from the drop-down list. The list of visualization options depends on the attribute type.
Depending on the selected visualization, additional customization fields may be displayed.
More about visualization types.
Configuring visualization depending on the attribute type.
For the attribute type "Numeric"/"Integer", user can configure visualization of the following types:
range:
range with slider:
range with preset options:
The ranges are added in the modal window after clicking on the
icon in the "Options" parameter.
Added options can be edited or deleted using the corresponding icons on the control panel in the "Options" parameter.

the numeric type discussed earlier
, except that the currency can be specified when configured. For example, a range with a slider can be customized as follows:
For the attribute type "Date"/"Date and Time" user can configure the type visualization:
date range:
date range with time:
The default start/end date can be set via algorithms in the "Start Date Algorithm" and "End Date Algorithm" parameters.
Two types of visualization can be configured for an attribute of the "Boolean" type, with the layout of the visualization on the search filter panel displayed in the settings window.
checkbox/checkbox with two states:
A default check mark can be defined for this by defining the value of the "Default value" parameter.
The following visualization can be configured for the "Object" type attribute:
drop-down list with multiple choice:
The availability of search filter objects can be configured by selecting/creating a filtering
algorithm
.
directory content in the form of a list-box:
Additional parameters are available when customizing this visualization:
Setting
Purpose
Hide search bar
Determining whether to display the search field in the search filters panel.
When the flag is active, the search field is hidden; when inactive, it is displayed.
Show "Select All" button
Displaying the "Select All" button for the configured filter elements on the search filters panel.
Name of the "Select All"
Name of the button to select all items in the directory.
The parameter is available if the "Show "Select All button"" parameter is active.
Number of displayed values
The parameter is used to define the number of items displayed in the configured filter. When the specified number is exceeded, pagination is displayed with the ability to navigate to a specific page.
The filter allows displaying from 1 to 100 items.
The default value is 5.
The "Child Object" attribute visual associated with the object type whose registry has search filters activated also displays a search and filtering panel by object.
Search filters can be embedded into any type of profile using widgets
"Search filters"
and
"Object registry"
.
After saving the changes using the
button, the registry appearance will change according to the settings made.
